question_text: Can we prove NEXPSPACE = EXPSPACE using the same technique?
answer: YES - NEXPSPACE = EXPSPACE via Generalized Savitch
proof_technique: Generalized Savitch via closure under squaring

key_lemma.name: Exponential Closure Lemma
key_lemma.statement: EXPSPACE is closed under squaring: EXPSPACE^2 SUBSET EXPSPACE

significance.theoretical: Validates Collapse Prediction Theorem at THIRD closure point
significance.methodological: Confirms Generalized Savitch is truly universal

key_insights: NEXPSPACE = EXPSPACE: Nondeterminism collapses at exponential
Exponential is closed under squaring (key lemma)
Generalized Savitch works at ALL closure points
The Collapse Prediction Theorem (Phase 81) is TRIPLY VALIDATED
Three closure points now confirmed: poly, qpoly, exponential
The mathematical structure is universal: B^2 SUBSET B => N-B = B
Space complexity collapses follow ONE universal pattern

new_questions.question: Can we prove N-k-EXPSPACE = k-EXPSPACE for all k simultaneously?
new_questions.connection: Follows from same proof for any fixed k

new_questions.question: Is there a single unified proof for ALL closure point collapses?
new_questions.expected_answer: YES - the template IS the unified proof

new_questions.question: Can we prove N-ELEMENTARY = ELEMENTARY as Phase 84?
new_questions.expected_answer: YES - same proof, elementary is universally closed

new_questions.question: Does the pattern extend to primitive recursive?
new_questions.expected_answer: YES - PR is also closed under squaring
